text: Hey all, hoping someone can give me a hand with the problem I'm experiencing. I'm trying to get the contacts data from HubSpot using the API with Python interface. Unfortunately the standard `api_client.crm.contacts.get_all()` only yields a couple of properties, but definitely not the whole list. I know that we use a bunch of custom properties on the contacts object and I am not seeing any of them. They also fail to show when querying for a specific id via `api_client.crm.contacts.basic_api.get_by_id()` . Do I have to specify the properties I'm after beforehand? How would I do that?
Hello! Is it possible to create a deal from a HubSpot form via api? Or something else, I need to have custom properties in my deal...
Hi, I need to Associate a ticket with contact. What i need to add in the ObjectType, ObectjID and associationType field?

It looks like the search api requires a timestamp’d filter value for a “date” (not datetime) field. I’m pretty sure this used to accept a string YYYY-MM-DD value, but that no longer works. Anyone know if the actual date used for filtering takes into account the user’s local timezone?

Yeah, requests do take a `properties` keyword in many cases that lets you specify. <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-python/blob/5cb86c8b6c793409443f72e741ac6c55b5d1c16b/sample-apps/contacts-app/src/routes/contacts.py#L82>
That example also shows how to enumerate them for a given object so you can make the list.
That is using `basic_api` but I think there is consistency such that it should work elsewhere. The endpoints take it.

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.

Is this a bug or intended? It seems like blog post api only grabs blog fields that have been edited. IE if you have a blog post with custom widgets and some of them are using default content that hasnt been edited at all -- Those fields do not show up in the api call.
Can we get widget_data added to the response of a blog_posts API call?
Hi everyone, theres some way to integrate HubSpot with clevertap to send automatically data fetch by hubstop to clevretap to preserve data in these two CRM platforms
Hey <@U01V3H8KSRH>, those aren’t usable via the API so we chose not to document them to avoid confusion. Did you have any specific questions on those fields?

Hey <@U01RU55DN1H> yes it is. You can use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals|this API> to create deals and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties|this on>e to create any custom properties you might need

Hi <@U01V8CG4QS2> The ObjectType would be Ticket Or Contact
The ObjectID will be an ID string representing the specific instance of the objects you need to associate, like `134248`
The associationType will be `contact_to_ticket`

Hey <@U017TRTEH1C> under the hood, dates are stored as datetimes at utc midnight and the input is a epoch millis string so there isn’t really a concept of timezone there, it’s just whatever value you want to provide the API
